not really. their damage paterns and strengths are entirely different. Burst mages rarely have the tools to engage into an enemy backline, and while their dps is similar, again, they don't have access to the backline. To assume that an assassin is worthless without kills because 'mages do it better' is absolutely ignorant of the roles of both assassins and mages. An asssassin's job is to flank and apply backline pressure, while a mage and adc's job is to apply damage to targets that you can attack without overextending.

You can generate massive leads off of CS in almost all brackets except korean chalanger, to the point where you can be ahead multiple kills worth of gold. And if you're that far ahead on CS, you generate the ability to item spike and kill people. 

You don't need to be snowballing on kills to be snowballing. I genuinely cannot count the number of game that I've won by zoning my opponent off lane by freezing lane and denying them the ability to farm into relevancy, while I continue to CS. Usually in these lanes, I end up some 60 CS, and when 17 CS is equal to a kill, that's effectively being up just less than 4 kills on the enemy laner, without even killing them once. And in these scenarios, the opponent ends up being so weak that the game becomes a 5v4. 

It doesnt matter what kind of champion you're playing, assassin, bruiser, tank, mage, etc, if you have an advantage, you can just deny your opponent to generate a fuckhuge lead.
And do you know the feeling of a game lasting too long and trying to kill an adc with two shield bots?

There is a no-boots nocturne build that I call ONE SHOT NOC. In practice mode, I tested the combo on a dummy. It did just over 1800 damage in half a second. 

R-Q-AA--hydra-AA-gunblade-ignite

Build is triforce, ravenous hydra, gunblade, and all 3 lethality items. You go thunderlords and every damage mastery, and lethality reds and quints. Full combo includes prepping edge of night's spell shield, so even though you're squishy AF it's hard to kill you through double SS.

Play mid or top. Rush triforce and ionian boots for mana and cdr. Then get the lethality items in whatever order you want. I usually buy a poacher's dirk and sit on it. It takes forever to get a chance to poach camps, but it also takes forever to build 3 full items so that's fine.

Finish off your build with hydra and gunblade, selling your boots for whichever you get last (by the time you finish all 3 lethality items you have a lot of out of combat MS and you have triforce/ghostblade/Q for in combat MS (not that you really need it, you're ONE SHOT NOC).

While I recognize Zed's one shot potential and am in no way disputing your statement, I don't think Zed is a great example of a truly unhealthy one shotter. He isn't in a great place right now, and the fact that lethality sucks makes it even worse. In addition, his kit relies on good skill and decision making by the player while offering good counterplay options for his opponents. If the combo sequence is off or he misses a Q, the whole thing is screwed and Zed could die. Now is probably a good time to bring up the fact that I'm completely biased because I'm a Zed main, but I think he is an example of a fair assassin who embodies the role of the class and is healthy for the game.
